title: Sarvesh Ramprakash Arrest Report (Los Angeles Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records, such as police blotter information, including time of arrest, charge, disposition and booking information related to the traffic stop, DUI arrest and detention of Sarvesh Ramprakash on Friday, November 7, 2014 by the officers of the Los Angeles Police Department.

The arresting officer given on the notice to appear is Castillo (NZ591); the arresting officer and transporting officer, respectively, given on the prisoner's receipt are Peake (34968) and Raygosa (38368).

A previous records request done through a private investigator produced the following response: "In accordance with the California Government Code, Section 6254(f), records of investigations conducted by, or investigatory files compiled by, any local police agency for law enforcement purposes are exempt from disclosure. To the extent that records were located, they are either investigatory records themselves or properly part of an investigative file."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarvesh Ramprakash

title: County of  Marin Youth and Family Services CPRA (Marin County Dept. of Health and Human Services)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the California  public  Records, we request the following  documents. CMCYFS and County of Marin are interchangeable terms for the purpose of this request.

1.	The number of children removed by “CMCYFS” of Marin in the year 2020 and 2021

2.	The number of those children removed  who were returned to their family within six months between 2020 and 2021. 

3.	Boilerplate contract for with foster families in Marin County for children being adopted out by “CMCYFS”

4.	Copy of “CMYFS” contract with CASA advocates.

5.	The annual budget of  “CMCYFS” County of Marin Youth Family and Development of Services for fiscal years 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023.

6.	Contracts with “CMCYFS” and Center Point for drug rehab services for parents and youth, 

7.	The number of parents who lost their parental rights, based on failure to meet mental health needs ,or for mental health related issues.

8.	How many children were adopted to a non-family member in 2019-2020, and 2020 -2021.

9.	How many children were adopted out of stated in 2019-2020, and 2020 -2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson
